poem:
**Upon Reading the News of a Discovery**

In yellowed grass beneath bent skies,  
a whisper from forgotten leaves—  
words scribed, storied roots stand alone,  
burrowing into fertile silence,  
tendril thoughts awaken, blossom—  
inkling shadows drawn to light,  
crumbling voices unearth the echoes,  
once sealed pages, now unveiled,  
between lost whispers and forever.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Land of Sweet Forever by Harper Lee review – newly discovered stories from an American great When a new book is published by a writer dead for a decade, there is always some suspicion that the bottom of the barrel is being scraped. When the writer is Harper Lee, there is also the unpleasant aftertaste of the release of her second novel, 2015’s Go Set a Watchman, which was promoted as a sequel to To Kill a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
